doc.after: Santo Domingo is served by two international airports, the main one being Las AmÃ©ricas International Airport (Spanish: Aeropuerto Internacional de las Americas). The airport has two terminals; the newer one, just completed in 2006, added five more gates on the northern end of the facility. As of 2010, the airport handled over 3.4 million passengers per year.[29] Las AmÃ©ricas is located in Punta Caucedo, 15Â km (9Â mi) east of the National District on DR-3. It is serviced by such airlines as majors Jetblue Airways, Delta Air Lines, Iberia, Air France and Cubana de AviaciÃ³n. as well as smaller ones like Sunrise Airways. The Aeropuerto Internacional La Isabela is a secondary, newly constructed airport located in the northern section of the city, within kilometres of the city center. It is not currently used as a major international airport, servicing mostly domestic and charter flights.
